name: SOC 2 Type II Framework
description: Service Organization Control 2 framework based on Trust Services Criteria covering Security, Availability, Processing Integrity, Confidentiality, and Privacy.

framework.name: SOC 2 Type II Framework
framework.description: Framework based on AICPA Trust Services Criteria for SOC 2 compliance

structure.title: CC1: Control Environment
structure.description: The set of standards, processes, and structures that provide the basis for carrying out internal control

items.title: CC1.1 - Commitment to Integrity and Ethics
items.description: The entity demonstrates a commitment to integrity and ethical values
questions: Is there a code of conduct?

items.title: CC1.2 - Board Independence and Oversight
items.description: The board of directors demonstrates independence and exercises oversight
questions: Does the board have independent members?
How often does the board meet?
What is the scope of board oversight?

items.title: CC1.3 - Management Structure and Authority
items.description: Management establishes structures, reporting lines, and authorities

structure.title: CC2: Communication and Information
structure.description: Information necessary to support the functioning of internal control

items.title: CC2.1 - Internal Communication
items.description: The entity internally communicates information necessary to support internal control
questions: How is control information communicated internally?
Is there a process for reporting issues?

items.title: CC2.2 - External Communication
items.description: The entity communicates with external parties
questions: How are commitments communicated to customers?
Is there external reporting on controls?
How are third parties informed of requirements?

structure.title: CC3: Risk Assessment
structure.description: The process of identifying, analyzing, and managing risks

items.title: CC3.1 - Risk Identification
items.description: The entity identifies and assesses risks to the achievement of objectives
items.summary: Identify risks that could impact objectives
questions: Is there a formal risk assessment process?

items.title: CC3.2 - Fraud Risk Assessment
items.description: The entity considers the potential for fraud

items.title: CC3.3 - Change Management Risk
items.description: The entity identifies and assesses changes that could impact internal control
questions: How are changes assessed for risk?
Is there a change management process?

structure.title: CC6: Logical and Physical Access Controls
structure.description: Controls over logical and physical access to systems and facilities

items.title: CC6.1 - Logical Access Security
items.description: The entity implements logical access security software and policies
items.summary: Control access to systems and data
questions: Is access based on least privilege?
How is access provisioned and revoked?

items.title: CC6.2 - Access Registration and Authorization
items.description: The entity registers and authorizes users prior to granting access
questions: Is there an access request process?

items.title: CC6.3 - Access Removal
items.description: The entity removes access when no longer needed
questions: Is there a process for role changes?

structure.title: CC7: System Operations
structure.description: Controls over system operations and monitoring

items.title: CC7.1 - Vulnerability Management
items.description: The entity detects and monitors vulnerabilities

items.title: CC7.2 - Security Monitoring
items.description: The entity monitors system components for anomalies and security events

items.title: CC7.3 - Incident Response
items.description: The entity responds to identified security incidents
questions: Is there an incident response plan?
Are roles defined for incident response?
